results.title: Product Manager
results.description:
We are now looking for a highly motivated individual that will be able to support this fast pace growth by ensuring that Gozem's product constantly evolves to meet the needs of its users. This role calls for a rare combination of problem-solving skills, creative business thinking, and strong interpersonal ability/people skills.

  • Strong focus on usability and interactive design.
  • Researching and analyzing industry UX/UI trends and competitor sites and strategies.
  • Regular review of usage data to analyze user behaviour, pain points and to inform design decisions.
  • Able to handle expectations of Stakeholders and setting clear vision and get buy in cross functional.

  • Bachelor or Masters in Computer Science, Electrical/Computer Engineering , Operations Research or Mathematics/Statistics

  • Familiarity with database structuring needed
  • Familiarity with API based product needed
  • Basic knowledge of any programming language a plus
  • Experience in interfacing with other teams and departments to deliver impact solutions for organisation

  • Detail-oriented and efficient time manager in a dynamic and fast-paced working environment
  • Fluent in French and English

¬†

Nice to have

  • Previous experience as a growth hacker in a startup or tech company is a plus
  • Experience in geospatial databases or graph databases
  • Recent programming experience in a production environment

About US

Gozem is Africa's Super App. The app, available on Android and iOS, provides a suite of transport, ecommerce and financial services to consumers and transport providers of Francophone Sub-saharan Africa.¬†

Gozem is currently operating in 8 cities in Togo and Benin with more than 400,000 registered users that have completed more than 2 million trips since their launch in November 2018.

results.title: Grant Finance and Compliance Manager
results.description:
The Luminos Fund, an international nonprofit bringing education opportunities to the world's most vulnerable children, seeks a Grant Finance and Compliance Manager to contribute to its rapid growth and expansion.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ¬†

The Grant Finance and Compliance Manager is a cross-cutting role that will work across multiple functions and teams at Luminos, including grant management, finance, compliance, contracting, programs, and operations. The Grant Finance and Compliance Manager will sit within the Finance team at Luminos, and report to the Director of Finance and Administration.‚ÄØ¬†

This full-time position can be based anywhere in the GMT -5 to +3 time zones (e.g., Boston, London, Addis Ababa, etc.). It will involve a certain amount of international travel to challenging contexts in the developing world.‚ÄØ¬†

ABOUT THE LUMINOS FUND¬†¬†

The Luminos Fund (www.luminosfund.org) provides transformative education programs to thousands of out-of-school children, helping them to catch up to grade level, reintegrate into government schools, and prepare for lifelong learning. Working in partnership with community-based organizations, Luminos is scaling up its accelerated learning program to ensure all children have equal access to joyful, foundational learning, especially those shut out of education by crisis, poverty, or discrimination. To date, Luminos has helped over 172,000 secure a second chance to learn. A registered 501(c)(3) non-profit, Luminos is working in Ethiopia, Ghana, Lebanon, Liberia, and The Gambia.‚ÄØ¬†

Luminos is supported by a range of funding partners, including Cartier Philanthropy, Dubai Cares, Legatum, and UBS Optimus Foundation. Luminos has been recognized for its achievements globally, receiving the 2022 Klaus J. Jacobs Best Practice Prize, the Library of Congress International Literacy Award, the Lipman Family Prize, the WISE Award, and the HundrED Global Innovation Award for the last five years.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ¬†

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES¬†

GRANT AND FINANCIAL MANAGEMENT¬†¬†

  • Monitor and coordinate the implementation of donor agreements and subawards and ensure that financial management policies and procedures are followed.‚ÄØ¬†
  • Ensure timely and accurate interpretation and implementation of donor restrictions and requirements.‚ÄØ¬†
  • Maximize the use of project budgets through effective allocation of expenditures across various grants.‚ÄØ¬†
  • Maintain and enhance the grants management dashboard in Salesforce.‚ÄØ¬†
  • Track reporting deadlines and requirements across multiple donors, countries, and projects.‚ÄØ¬†
  • Prepare financial reports for donors, including bilateral donors and foundations.‚ÄØ¬†
  • Ensure all Luminos financial and administrative policies are implemented with the highest levels of integrity.‚ÄØ¬†

CONTRACT MANAGEMENT¬†¬†

  • Manage contracting processes with local partners and suppliers, including conducting due diligence checks, drafting, and approving contracts, filing, and tracking required documentation, ensuring on-time grant disbursement, and reviewing and filing partner reports.‚ÄØ¬†
  • Maintain grant documentation filing system.‚ÄØ¬†
  • Process partner and supplier invoices in a timely manner.‚ÄØ¬†
  • Support partners to develop and implement appropriate financial procedures and systems in support of effective project implementation.‚ÄØ¬†

COMPLIANCE¬†

  • Manage compliance and legal processes for Luminos' local entities and in-country partners, including local labor laws, tax filing, registration, annual subsidiary board meetings, etc.‚ÄØ¬†
  • Ensure staff and partners are in compliance with child protection, whistle-blower, and other critical risk management policies.‚ÄØ¬†

QUALIFICATIONS¬†

  • Bachelor's Degree or equivalent.‚ÄØ¬†
  • Advanced skills in Excel and Salesforce. Eagerness to learn new applications.‚ÄØ¬†
  • At least five years of experience in the international development sector working with international organizations in a finance, grant management, and/or compliance capacity.‚ÄØ¬†
  • Familiarity with donor financial compliance and reporting requirements, ideally bilateral and multilateral donors.‚ÄØ¬†
  • Previous experience reviewing, revising, and executing contracts and legal agreements in trans-national contexts.‚ÄØ¬†
  • Previous experience developing and enforcing compliance, financial and legal policies across multiple countries and teams in Sub-Saharan Africa.‚ÄØ¬†
  • Bookkeeping skills are an advantage.‚ÄØ¬†
  • Superb attention to detail.‚ÄØ¬†
  • Passion for education in marginalized communities.‚ÄØ¬†

CORE ATTRIBUTES

  • Belief and demonstrated passion for the mission, vision, and values of the Luminos Fund.‚ÄØ¬†
  • Impeccable integrity and a can-do attitude.‚ÄØ¬†
  • Readiness to problem solve creatively on a myriad of fronts and go above and beyond to deliver optimum success.‚ÄØ¬†
  • Natural affinity for technology and a love of data.‚ÄØ¬†
  • Team player, with a belief in the power of positivity and appreciative inquiry.‚ÄØ¬†
  • Passion for unlocking the very best from diverse constituents, partners, and colleagues.‚ÄØ¬†
  • Innate sense of responsibility for delivery of quality work, even in adverse circumstances.‚ÄØ¬†
  • Self-motivated, with the ability to work independently in challenging international contexts, as required.‚ÄØ¬†
  • Belief that success lies in the details.‚ÄØ¬†



The Luminos Fund is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran, or disability status.‚ÄØ¬†

results.title: Marketing Manager
results.description:
We are seeking a creative yet structured Marketing Manager to grow our marketing engine and change the way people with chronic conditions receive care. In this remote role, you will be critical in developing and running high-performing campaigns that drive qualified B2B leads, with a strong bias towards rapid iteration and experimentation. You will be responsible for creating and executing growth marketing campaigns and brand strategy across email, direct mail, paid media, sponsorships, and events to fill our sales funnel.¬†

Who is Better Health?

Better Health is a new type of medical provider built on peer to peer connection, helping people with chronic conditions live and age at home. We bundle peer support, education, and home delivery of medical supplies in an end-to-end digital care solution. We help our members discover and purchase the best medical equipment and supplies to address their underlying chronic conditions and receive the education and support they need to thrive at home.¬†

Since our inception in November 2019, Better Health has gained Medicare licenses in 46 states, 16 Medicaid licenses, and preferred national provider contracts with leading payers, including Oscar Health and Humana. This has allowed our member base to rapidly grow with virtually no churn. We are backed by Caffeinated Capital, General Catalyst, Mastry, 8VC, Bill Ackman and¬† a large group of experienced investors and entrepreneurs (see our series A announcement post).¬†

So, what will you do as our Marketing Manager?

  • Be the right-hand person to our head of marketing for everything marketing related in Better Health ‚Äî you will be involved in setting the strategy, experimenting with new channels, executing programs, and measuring success
  • Develop value propositions, messaging, and go-to-market assets that drive demand with our target audiences of health insurance companies (payers), healthcare providers, and patients
  • Collaborate with internal teams on member marketing & communications, implementing campaigns across email, SMS, and direct mail
  • Develop content marketing and website presence that resonates with our prospects¬†
  • Ensure marketing efforts are measurable and performing. Develop and evaluate reports and extract key insights that impact our website, marketing goals, and sales funnel
  • Ensure consistent branding across the company, maintaining and disseminating style guides and asset library¬†
  • Manage vendors and freelancers to drive on-brand and effective marketing deliverables
  • Brainstorm with teams to develop creative solutions and growth strategies

Sounds exciting? We‚Äôre interested in YOU if this sounds like you:¬†

  • You like to be involved in everything so you can use your broad range of skills, from developing value propositions and writing high-impact copy, to creating growth campaigns and marketing analytics that report on success¬†
  • Ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously, can pivot quickly, with relentless followthrough
  • Have 3-7 years of experience in B2B marketing, at a fast-growing startup, healthcare a big plus
  • Are a proven builder of high-performing marketing campaigns and programs, with demonstrated success rolling out content marketing initiatives¬†
  • Ability to tell a succinct, meaningful, and actionable story with data using visualization and other techniques
  • Ability and insight to drive improvements in design, traffic, and website content.
  • Adept with aspects of digital marketing like SEO, marketing automation, and email marketing, but also know how to explore/develop new marketing channels
  • Communicative and solutions-oriented ‚Äî You are the first to flag an issue and have already thought of potential solutions¬†
  • Outcomes driven ‚Äî You focus on the end goal, reporting on the so-what and the impact, not just the activity
  • Analytical with a narrative ‚Äî You think like a journalist. Excellent researcher, ask the right questions, focus on metrics, and can extract insights from data to tell a powerful story.¬†
  • Familiar with MixPanel, Google Analytics, LinkedIn Campaign Manager.¬†

Now, why choose Better Health?

For starters, our benefits include:

  • Competitive salary + equity package
  • Healthcare & Dental¬†
  • Flexible PTO
  • Full remote flexibility¬†
  • Joining a team driven to improving the lives of those living with chronic conditions

But most importantly, here at Better Health, our mission is to bring information, access, and support to people managing chronic conditions at home. Our diverse team is united by our shared values:

  • Open dialogue with radical transparency
  • Creativity to run with ideas
  • Collaboration across teams

If you're fired up at the thought of revitalizing a tired $60 billion industry and passionate about user-focused solutions, join us!

¬†---

Better Health is committed to being an employer that provides not just a good place to work, but a great and inclusive place to work. To that end, we strive to recruit and maintain a workforce that meaningfully represents the diverse and culturally rich communities that we serve. At Better Health, we are committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion.

We are an equal-opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, disability status or, any other basis protected by federal, state or local law, ordinance or regulation.

results.title: Marketing Cloud Consultant
results.description:
Description

Tectonic is a leading technology and business services company serving mid-sized business to enterprise customers with a focus on Insight to Action automation in the cloud. Insight to Action is the intersection of big data, analytics, marketing automation, and CRM that provides an integrated approach to automating customer interaction. We are looking for a talented Solution Architect to join our team.

Roles and Responsibilities:

  • Lead consultative engagements with customers to uncover technical and business goals and challenges
  • Create and document customer user stories, requirements, and technical overviews of solutions
  • Present solutions to both technical and business clients
  • Use SFMC AMPscript, scripting language, to build dynamic content into HTML
  • Implement visual elements and their behaviors with user interactions
  • Provide subject matter expertise to internal and external teams during sales and delivery processes

Requirements

  • Minimum of 2 years of hands-on experience with Salesforce Marketing Cloud
  • Development experience using SFMC AMPscript, HTML/CSS, SQL, Javascript
  • Strong working experience with dynamic content, interactive templates, and the development of cloud pages
  • Experience working with Salesforce Marketing Cloud at the API level
  • Attention to detail in all aspects of development and communication
